intro: Guarea gigantea, commonly known as the giant guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related hardwoods. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a dense, umbrella-shaped crown. Its leaves are alternate, pinnate, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
